fields.heading: Frank Lampard lost Everton job after 'bust-up' with first team player
fields.content:
Frank Lampard lost Everton job after 'bust-up' with first team player

 
Ryan Sidle
  •  
  •  
  •  
  •  

Published 16:50, 23 January 2023 GMT
| Last updated 16:50, 23 January 2023 GMT

Featured Image Credit: Alamy

Frank Lampard's sacking came just days after a training ground 'bust-up' with one of his first team players led to him being dropped from training with the first team.

On Monday it was confirmed that Lampard's time at Everton had come to an end, just a week short of a year since he took over the reigns at the club.

He just about managed to keep them in the Premier League at the end of last season, with a come from behind win over Crystal Palace in the penultimate game of the campaign.

However they have been plunged straight back into a relegation fight again, and having sold Richarlison last summer there is no obvious person to get them out of it.

 

Blue is brave. Blue is brilliant. Blue is h̶i̶s̶ #HerStory unfolding, LIVE. Back the #WomenInBlue for the #ICCWomensT20WorldCup - I know I will! #IndVsPak| TODAY |6PM Onwards - only on Star Sports network @StarSportsIndia #ad pic.twitter.com/1M7knHgMPn

— Virat Kohli (@imVkohli) February 12, 2023

fields.heading: Gabriel Jesus announces return from injury, causing excitement among Arsenal fans.
fields.image_alt: Featured Image Credit: TW/GabrielJesus and GettyImages
fields.content:
During a conversation with UFC fighter Khabib Nurmagomedov, Arsenal striker Gabriel Jesus seemed to indicate when he will be back from injury.

The 25-year-old has been out of play since December when he sustained a knee injury while playing for Brazil in the World Cup. Prior to the injury, Jesus had been performing well for Arsenal after joining the team from Manchester City, with 5 goals and 6 assists in his first season.

Despite Gabriel Jesus' injury absence, Mikel Arteta's team has been making progress toward their first Premier League title in 19 years. However, the manager prefers to have a fully fit squad for the remainder of the season. This is why the striker's recent update on his fitness will likely be met with excitement from fans.

Gabriel Jesus was present at the Emirates Stadium during Arsenal's thrilling 3-2 victory over Manchester United on Sunday evening.

Despite Marcus Rashford's early goal for United, Arsenal's Eddie Nketiah, who was filling in for Jesus, scored the equalizer with a header from a well-placed cross by Granit Xhaka.

The Gunners took the lead early in the second half with a goal from Bukayo Saka but were soon tied again by Lisandro Martinez's first goal in the Premier League.

In the closing moments of the match, Arsenal pressed forward for a winning goal, which they found through Nketiah, who directed Martin Odegaard's shot past David de Gea for his second goal of the game.

When questioned about his injury recovery, Gabriel Jesus stated that he would likely be returning in "four or five weeks more."

However, it will not be easy for him to immediately regain his spot in the starting lineup. Eddie Nketiah, who has filled in for Jesus, is now Arsenal's top scorer across all competitions, having scored his eighth and ninth goals of the season against Manchester United.

After the match, Arteta praised Nketiah, calling him "incredible" and commending his ability to step into Jesus' role effectively.

Arteta said: "Eddie's performance is incredible. We couldn't have predicted this, but we had hope because of his mindset, qualities, and how well they fit within the team. Losing Jesus was a significant loss, but Eddie is stepping up and the team is responding exceptionally."

The next game for Arsenal will be against Manchester City on Friday evening in the FA Cup, it will be an exciting match-up as the teams have not yet faced each other this season.
fields.keywords: Arsenal, Premier League, Gabriel Jesus, Khabib
fields.seo_description: Gabriel Jesus announces return from injury, Arsenal fans eagerly await his comeback.

fields.heading: Manchester City is reportedly willing to include a key player in a potential swap deal for Rafael Leao
fields.sub_heading: Recent transfer rumors have suggested that Manchester City is considering a move for AC Milan player Rafael Leao, with the possibility of a key player being offered in exchange.
fields.image_alt: Rafael Leao, an AC Milan player, has been the subject of strong rumors linking him with a move to Manchester City (Image credit - Getty Images)
fields.content:
According to reports, Manchester City is willing to exchange Joao Cancelo for AC Milan's Portugal forward, Rafael Leao. This comes as Leao has received praise for his performances with the Italian club and also scored two goals alongside Cancelo during the World Cup in Qatar last month.

Despite Cancelo's previous successes, he has not been a guaranteed starter at Manchester City this season. According to reports from Calciomercatoweb, City's manager, Pep Guardiola, may be willing to let Cancelo leave the club in the summer as part of a deal to acquire the highly-regarded Portuguese forward, Rafael Leao, from AC Milan for the next season.



Rafael Leao, the highly-regarded Portuguese forward from AC Milan, has had a successful campaign this season, scoring nine goals and providing as many assists in 25 appearances. His overall record in Serie A is 31 goals in 112 matches. However, Leao's current contract with Milan has only 18 months left to run, and the club may be forced to sell him.

Reports suggest Manchester City may be interested in acquiring Leao. While there is no confirmation if Milan would accept the proposal, it is worth noting that Cancelo has also attracted interest from other clubs, including Real Madrid.

According to reports from The Athletic, Manchester City is in talks with French Ligue 1 team FC Lorient regarding the permanent transfer of Scotland midfielder, Josh Adam. Adam, 18, began his professional career with Celtic and joined City in 2020.

In his first season with the club, he helped the team win the Premier League U18 title. This season, he has made 12 appearances in Premier League 2, playing for a total of 530 minutes. However, the reports suggest that there is still more work to be done in order for the transfer to be completed.
fields.keywords: Manchester City, Premier League, Serie A, Transfer News, Rafael Leao, Joao Cancelo
fields.seo_description: Manchester City may trade Joao Cancelo for AC Milan's Rafael Leao in a potential swap deal.

fields.heading: Gareth Bale announces his first PGA Tour appearance after announcing his retirement two weeks ago.
fields.sub_heading: Two weeks after retiring from professional football, Gareth Bale has announced that he will be making his debut at a PGA Tour event. He will be competing as a golfer for the first time as a professional.
fields.image_alt: Gareth Bale playing Golf (Image credit - Gareth Bale/Instagram & Getty Images)
fields.content:
Former professional footballer Gareth Bale, who announced his retirement in January after representing Wales in their first World Cup finals in 58 years, will make his golf debut at a PGA Tour event just two weeks after hanging up his cleats.

The 33-year-old scored Wales' lone goal at the tournament, a penalty in a 1-1 draw against the USMNT in their opening Group B match. Coincidentally, his final club was LAFC, which is based in the United States and plays in Major League Soccer.

Gareth Bale, the retired five-time Champions League winner, surprised fans on Monday by announcing on Instagram that he will be participating in next month's AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am tournament in California.

The four-day event, which is held at Pebble Beach, has a massive $9 million prize. Although the prize money is significant, it seems that Bale is more interested in the opportunity to compete and showcase his golf skills.

The AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am tournament will feature 156 professional golfers competing across three courses: Pebble Beach Golf Links, Spyglass Hill Golf Course, and Monterey Peninsula Country Club.

The event will also include notable celebrities such as actor Bill Murray and musician Macklemore. Although Bale may have an athletic advantage over these celebrities, it is unclear how it will translate to his performance on the golf course.

It's worth noting that Bale has a three-hole golf course at his house in Wales, which has been designed to mimic some of the world's top golf venues.

Bale, during his time in Madrid, unfurled a banner that read "Wales. Golf. Madrid. In that order," which caused a significant rift between him and Real Madrid fans. This led to him spending the following season on loan at Tottenham Hotspur, the club he left in 2013 to join Real Madrid.

In a statement announcing his retirement, Bale stated that after careful consideration, he decided to retire from club and international football, feeling grateful for the opportunity to pursue his passion for the sport and for the memorable moments it provided him over 17 seasons. He also mentioned that it would be impossible to replicate such experiences in the future.
fields.keywords: Premier League, La Liga, Gareth Bale, Golf, Champions League, Trending
fields.seo_description: Gareth Bale to debut in PGA Tour event post-football retirement.

fields.heading: Is Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's Liverpool Career Over? Premier League Club Offers to Sign him - But Under One Condition
fields.content:
Brighton & Hove Albion is interested in signing Liverpool player Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain during the current transfer window, if Liverpool agrees to let him go without a transfer fee.

Oxlade-Chamberlain, who is 29 years old, has been a prominent member of Jurgen Klopp's team since joining from Arsenal for £35 million in 2017. He has played a key role in Liverpool's success, including winning the Premier League and the UEFA Champions League.

Oxlade-Chamberlain is known for his versatility and strength as a box-to-box player, but has lost his place in the starting lineup at Liverpool due to recurring injuries this season. His contract with the club is set to end this summer, and it is likely that he will leave Liverpool on a free transfer.

According to the Daily Mail, Brighton is considering signing Oxlade-Chamberlain in the last week of January to replace Leandro Trossard, who has left the team. However, Brighton is unwilling to pay a transfer fee and will only move forward with the signing if Liverpool agrees to let him go without a fee.

The idea of allowing Oxlade-Chamberlain to leave without a transfer fee may not be attractive to Liverpool, but it would mean they can save on the midfielder's £120,000-a-week salary for the next six months.

However, due to injuries to Luis Diaz, Diogo Jota, and Roberto Firmino, Klopp would prefer to keep Oxlade-Chamberlain on the team for the time being. Overall, he has scored 18 goals and provided 15 assists in 143 appearances for Liverpool.

 

A new chapter begins in my journey with Arsenal. I just signed a new contract 😍 Arsenal for me isn’t just a club I joined 7 years ago, which makes me the longest serving player currently ☺️ Arsenal is home, family, happiness, growth, and ambition. My Arsenal family, I love you♥️ pic.twitter.com/yOTw48O2xN

— Mohamed ELNeny (@ElNennY) February 21, 2023
fields.keywords: Liverpool, Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, Premier League, Brighton And Hove Albion
fields.seo_description: Discover the shocking condition that Premier League team is demanding before signing Liverpool midfielder Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain in the January transfer window

fields.heading: Chelsea may face departures of Mason Mount and 4 others as contract negotiations stall. Get ready for a potential summer shake-up.
fields.sub_heading: Mass Exodus Looming at Chelsea FC: Mount, Kovacic, Mendy, Kante and Gallagher in Contract Limbo
fields.content:
Chelsea FC is facing the possibility of a mass exodus this summer, with several players reportedly stuck in contract talks and their future at the club in jeopardy. The new owners are eager to avoid the mistakes made by the previous regime, which saw key players such as Antonio Rudiger and Andreas Christensen leave on a free transfer.

Mount's Contract Talks Stall

Mason Mount, who was the Chelsea Player of the Year for the last two seasons, has been in contract talks for some time but is yet to agree on terms. Despite his accolades, Mount's form has dipped this season, leaving his future at the club in the balance.

Kovacic's Future in Doubt

Mateo Kovacic will enter the final year of his contract this summer, and the club has yet to open talks with him. As per the Evening Standard, Kovacic is unlikely to be offered a new deal and a sale in the summer looks imminent.

Mendy's Starting Spot Lost

Edouard Mendy has lost his starting spot to Kepa Arrizabalaga since Graham Potter took over as manager. The Senegal international has spent most of his time on the sidelines due to injuries, and he too is close to being sold in the summer.

Kante Reluctant to Agree to New Deal

N'Golo Kante is in the final months of his contract at Chelsea and is reluctant to agree to a two-year deal on the table. The Frenchman has yet to play under Potter and is expected to return to training in March.

Gallagher's Future Uncertain

Conor Gallagher was almost sold in the January transfer window when Everton tabled a £40 million bid for the midfielder. However, the club chose to keep Gallagher and sold Jorginho to Arsenal instead. His future at Chelsea is uncertain, with several clubs reportedly circling to poach him.

Squad Trimming Needed

Chelsea has a large squad right now, and several players have been left out of the UEFA Champions League team, including Aubameyang, Noni Madueke, and Benoît Badiashile. A squad trimming is needed in the summer, and those stalling contracts and those not regularly used by Graham Potter are likely to be the ones leaving.

In conclusion, Chelsea FC is facing a crucial summer, with several key players' futures in the balance. The club's new owners will look to avoid the mistakes made by the previous regime and ensure a smooth transition for the team. The squad trimming is necessary to keep the team competitive and focused on achieving success in the coming season.

Tomas Soucek. https://t.co/1jdH2D5SLM pic.twitter.com/WfENv2lQv1

— Chelsea FC (@ChelseaFC) February 11, 2023
fields.keywords: Chelsea, Premier League, Mason Mount, Ngolo Kante, Mateo Kovacic, Conor Gallagher
fields.seo_description: Chelsea's Future in Doubt as Key Players, Including Mason Mount, Face Potential Departure Amid Contract Negotiation Hurdles

fields.heading: Cristiano Ronaldo Scores Four Goals for Al-Nassr in Saudi Pro League, Reaches Milestone
fields.sub_heading: Cristiano Ronaldo Shines in Saudi Pro League with Four Goals for Al-Nassr
fields.content:
After a slow start to his stint with Al-Nassr, Cristiano Ronaldo finally announced himself in the Saudi Pro League with a stunning performance on Thursday night. The veteran striker, at 38 years old, scored four goals in the match against Al-Wehda, reaching a phenomenal personal milestone in the process.

First Goal: A Powerful Finish Ronaldo's first goal was a testament to his skill and technique. He received a pass down the channel and finished with a powerful, left-footed shot across the goalkeeper.

Poacher's Instincts on Display The Portugal captain showed his poacher's instincts for his second goal, as he raced in-behind to latch onto a through-ball and finish under Abdulquddus Atiah.

Penalty Goal and a Fourth to Reach 503 Career League Goals In the second half, Ronaldo made no mistake from the penalty spot to score his third goal of the night. A fourth goal was added just after the hour mark, as he slid the ball into the empty net after the goalkeeper could only paw his shot back into his path.

Al-Nassr's Push for Another League Title Ronaldo's goals set Al-Nassr on a path to a much-needed victory as they push for another league title. Despite mixed form since signing the superstar on a contract worth £173 million per year, the Middle Eastern giants have a game in hand over their title rivals Al-Shabab.

503 Career League Goals: A Phenomenal Milestone Of Ronaldo's 503 career league goals, just three came in the Primeira Liga for Sporting Lisbon. He scored 84 in the Premier League during his first stint at Manchester United, before joining Real Madrid in 2009 for a world-record £80m transfer.

Is Cristiano Ronaldo the greatest player of all time? Share your thoughts in the comments!
fields.seo_description: Cristiano Ronaldo scores historic 4 goals for Al-Nassr in Saudi Pro League, cementing his status as a legend.

fields.heading: Stay with Juventus, Even If They Miss Out on the Champions League, Advises Lecce Director Corvino to Dusan Vlahovic
fields.content:
Dusan Vlahovic, the Serbian striker, has been the center of attention in recent transfer rumors, especially if Juventus misses out on the Champions League. Lecce director Pantaleo Corvino, who played a significant role in bringing the 23-year-old forward to Fiorentina, has advised him to stay in Turin. Corvino spoke highly of the striker and his talents, stating that Vlahovic is not up for discussion, and he has all the qualities of a complete center forward.

Critics Aimed at Vlahovic

Recently, there have been criticisms aimed at Vlahovic's performance, but Corvino believes the young striker's talent speaks for itself. In an interview with La Gazzetta dello Sport, he said that Vlahovic has a sense for goal, good technique, progression, aerial skills, and a physique that makes him a complete center forward. He also pointed out that Vlahovic is still young and has a bright future ahead of him.

Stay with Juventus

Despite the recent rumors, Corvino advises Vlahovic to stay in Turin, even if they miss out on the Champions League. He believes that Juventus is always a point of arrival, and the calm always arrives after a storm. Vlahovic is contracted with Juventus until June 2026, and he has been performing well this season, scoring eight goals and providing two assists in 12 Serie A appearances.

Impressions of Tiago Pinto

Corvino also spoke highly of Roma sporting director Tiago Pinto in the interview. He appreciates the way Pinto worked on the market, despite the financial fair play restrictions. He believes that a director's success is judged by what he finds when he arrives and what he leaves behind when he departs, as well as by results. Corvino was impressed by the management of the Dybala signing and the management of Zaniolo out by Tiago Pinto.

Premier League Interest

Vlahovic's impressive performance has caught the eye of several Premier League clubs, including Chelsea and Arsenal. If Juventus misses out on the Champions League this season, these clubs may look to pick up the Serbian striker in a high-profile transfer.

Arsenal are reportedly keen on signing Dusan Vlahovic, with the Serbian reportedly wanting out of Juventus pic.twitter.com/O00U62ebyJ

— The Sun Football ⚽ (@TheSunFootball) February 7, 2023

Lecce director Pantaleo Corvino believes that Dusan Vlahovic has a bright future ahead of him and should stay with Juventus, even if they miss out on the Champions League. He is impressed by the young striker's talents and considers him a complete center forward. Despite recent transfer rumors, Vlahovic is contracted with Juventus until June 2026, and he has been performing well this season. The Premier League clubs, including Chelsea and Arsenal, are interested in picking up the striker should Juventus miss out on the Champions League.
fields.seo_description: Lecce Director Corvino advises striker Dusan Vlahovic to stay with Juventus despite potential Champions League miss.

However, visitors may choose to decline the use of DART cookies by visiting the Google ad and content network Privacy Policy at the following URL – https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads

Some of advertisers on our site may use cookies and web beacons. Our advertising partners are listed below. Each of our advertising partners has their own Privacy Policy for their policies on user data. For easier access, we hyperlinked to their Privacy Policies below. Google

https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads

Advertising Partners Privacy Policies

You may consult this list to find the Privacy Policy for each of the advertising partners of Sights Football.

Third-party ad servers or ad networks uses technologies like cookies, JavaScript, or Web Beacons that are used in their respective advertisements and links that appear on Sights Football, which are sent directly to users' browser. They automatically receive your IP address when this occurs. These technologies are used to measure the effectiveness of their advertising campaigns and/or to personalize the advertising content that you see on websites that you visit.

Note that Sights Football has no access to or control over these cookies that are used by third-party advertisers.

Third Party Privacy Policies

Sights Football's Privacy Policy does not apply to other advertisers or websites. Thus, we are advising you to consult the respective Privacy Policies of these third-party ad servers for more detailed information. It may include their practices and instructions about how to opt-out of certain options.

You can choose to disable cookies through your individual browser options. To know more detailed information about cookie management with specific web browsers, it can be found at the browsers' respective websites.

CCPA Privacy Rights (Do Not Sell My Personal Information)

Under the CCPA, among other rights, California consumers have the right to:

Request that a business that collects a consumer's personal data disclose the categories and specific pieces of personal data that a business has collected about consumers.

Request that a business delete any personal data about the consumer that a business has collected.

Request that a business that sells a consumer's personal data, not sell the consumer's personal data.

If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.

GDPR Data Protection Rights

We would like to make sure you are fully aware of all of your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:

The right to access – You have the right to request copies of your personal data. We may charge you a small fee for this service.

The right to rectification – You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate. You also have the right to request that we complete the information you believe is incomplete.

The right to erasure – You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.

The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.

The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.

The right to data portability – You have the right to request that we transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.

If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.

Children's Information

Another part of our priority is adding protection for children while using the internet. We encourage parents and guardians to observe, participate in, and/or monitor and guide their online activity.

Sights Football does not knowingly collect any Personal Identifiable Information from children under the age of 13. If you think that your child provided this kind of information on our website, we strongly encourage you to contact us immediately and we will do our best efforts to promptly remove such information from our records.

Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, we advise you to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. These changes are effective immediately, after they are posted on this page.

 

Contact Us

If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us at sightsfootball@gmail.com

Cookie Policy for Sights Football

This is the Cookie Policy for Sights Football, accessible from https://sightsfootball.com/

What Are Cookies

As is common practice with almost all professional websites this site uses cookies, which are tiny files that are downloaded to your computer, to improve your experience. This page describes what information they gather, how we use it and why we sometimes need to store these cookies. We will also share how you can prevent these cookies from being stored however this may downgrade or 'break' certain elements of the sites functionality.

How We Use Cookies

We use cookies for a variety of reasons detailed below. Unfortunately in most cases there are no industry standard options for disabling cookies without completely disabling the functionality and features they add to this site. It is recommended that you leave on all cookies if you are not sure whether you need them or not in case they are used to provide a service that you use.

Disabling Cookies

You can prevent the setting of cookies by adjusting the settings on your browser (see your browser Help for how to do this). Be aware that disabling cookies will affect the functionality of this and many other websites that you visit. Disabling cookies will usually result in also disabling certain functionality and features of the this site. Therefore it is recommended that you do not disable cookies. 

The Cookies We Set

Account related cookies

If you create an account with us then we will use cookies for the management of the signup process and general administration. These cookies will usually be deleted when you log out however in some cases they may remain afterwards to remember your site preferences when logged out.

Login related cookies

We use cookies when you are logged in so that we can remember this fact. This prevents you from having to log in every single time you visit a new page. These cookies are typically removed or cleared when you log out to ensure that you can only access restricted features and areas when logged in.

Email newsletters related cookies

This site offers newsletter or email subscription services and cookies may be used to remember if you are already registered and whether to show certain notifications which might only be valid to subscribed/unsubscribed users.

Surveys related cookies

From time to time we offer user surveys and questionnaires to provide you with interesting insights, helpful tools, or to understand our user base more accurately. These surveys may use cookies to remember who has already taken part in a survey or to provide you with accurate results after you change pages.

Forms related cookies

When you submit data to through a form such as those found on contact pages or comment forms cookies may be set to remember your user details for future correspondence.

Site preferences cookies

In order to provide you with a great experience on this site we provide the functionality to set your preferences for how this site runs when you use it. In order to remember your preferences we need to set cookies so that this information can be called whenever you interact with a page is affected by your preferences.

Third Party Cookies

In some special cases we also use cookies provided by trusted third parties. The following section details which third party cookies you might encounter through this site.

This site uses Google Analytics which is one of the most widespread and trusted analytics solution on the web for helping us to understand how you use the site and ways that we can improve your experience. These cookies may track things such as how long you spend on the site and the pages that you visit so we can continue to produce engaging content.

For more information on Google Analytics cookies, see the official Google Analytics page.

Third party analytics are used to track and measure usage of this site so that we can continue to produce engaging content. These cookies may track things such as how long you spend on the site or pages you visit which helps us to understand how we can improve the site for you.

From time to time we test new features and make subtle changes to the way that the site is delivered. When we are still testing new features these cookies may be used to ensure that you receive a consistent experience whilst on the site whilst ensuring we understand which optimisations our users appreciate the most.

As we sell products it's important for us to understand statistics about how many of the visitors to our site actually make a purchase and as such this is the kind of data that these cookies will track. This is important to you as it means that we can accurately make business predictions that allow us to monitor our advertising and product costs to ensure the best possible price.

The Google AdSense service we use to serve advertising uses a DoubleClick cookie to serve more relevant ads across the web and limit the number of times that a given ad is shown to you.

For more information on Google AdSense see the official Google AdSense privacy FAQ.

We use adverts to offset the costs of running this site and provide funding for further development. The behavioural advertising cookies used by this site are designed to ensure that we provide you with the most relevant adverts where possible by anonymously tracking your interests and presenting similar things that may be of interest.

Several partners advertise on our behalf and affiliate tracking cookies simply allow us to see if our customers have come to the site through one of our partner sites so that we can credit them appropriately and where applicable allow our affiliate partners to provide any bonus that they may provide you for making a purchase.

We also use social media buttons and/or plugins on this site that allow you to connect with your social network in various ways. For these to work the following social media sites including; Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Youtube, and Google will set cookies through our site which may be used to enhance your profile on their site or contribute to the data they hold for various purposes outlined in their respective privacy policies.

More Information

Hopefully that has clarified things for you and as was previously mentioned if there is something that you aren't sure whether you need or not it's usually safer to leave cookies enabled in case it does interact with one of the features you use on our site.

For more general information on cookies, please read the Cookies Policy article.

However if you are still looking for more information then you can contact us through one of our preferred contact methods: Email: sightsfootball@gmail.com
